instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: Hi , ive got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which had a liquid spill , <CHIP>U7420</CHIP> was shorted to ground , replaced <CHIP>U7420</CHIP> and laptop switching on but no display , i did get a display once but when i turnt it off it didnt come back again . I have 3.3v on <SIGNAL>PP3V_S5_LCD</SIGNAL> @ <CHIP>U8501</CHIP> , <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SOSW_LCD_R</SIGNAL> is missing, <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_SLEW_3V3</SIGNAL> is also missing, <SIGNAL>PANEL_P3V3_EN</SIGNAL> is also missing but im struggling to see where this rail is created in diode mode this rail reads .546 so it shouldnt be shorted, any pointers in the right direction would be great

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7420</CHIP> is on iGPU power supply.
Probably bad CPU.

Did you check external video and USB activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: looks like i get a picture / usb activity in about 1 in 20 times of switching on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message:
Resolder all components in liquid affected area.
Heat CPU with quality flux; there may be accumulated crap underneath.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image
threads.message: little update , i did reflow all the components and flux the cpu and put it through the ultra sonic again which made no difference however ive just realised the board turns on everytime if i leave it disconnected until it goes stone cold
